events.comment: Checks if dogplayer is next to the sugar & that they are facing right. If the dog is ever supposed to be to the left of the sugar then we'd have to change the code to let it also push that way. Every frame Sugar_Is_Being_Pushed is set to false, and only gets set to true if the dog is pushing it

The actual "collision" part of the code. Although technically I'm not actually checking collision cause for some reason it wasn't working lol, instead I just check which way the dog is facing & if its really close to the sugar

If the dog is not pushing object, it slowly comes to a stop starting from a speed of Dog_Last_Push_Speed, which was updated to the dog's speed last time it was pushing the sugar. (Checks that its not being pushed & that the angle of  object movement is to the right)

If the dog is not pushing object & its angle of movement is going left (ie it has come to a stop and the forces applied to it are pushing it to the left) set the last push speed to 0 & remove all forces, as well as resets the Dog_Last_Push_Speed variable

If the dog is not pushing object, it slowly comes to a stop starting from a speed of Dog_Last_Push_Speed, which was updated to the dog's speed last time it was pushing the sugar. (Checks that its not being pushed & that the angle of  object movement is to the right)

If the dog is not pushing object & its angle of movement is going left (ie it has come to a stop and the forces applied to it are pushing it to the left) set the last push speed to 0 & remove all forces, as well as resets the Dog_Last_Push_Speed variable
If the sugar is touching the wall, stop
Changes the buttons x position to be in the very middle of the scene

Changes the scene to "VerticalSlice" which basically just reloads the scene. However if we want to make it so this resets players to the start of their current room we'd have to make it something different.

The actual "collision" part of the code. Although technically I'm not actually checking collision cause for some reason it wasn't working lol, instead I just check which way the dog is facing & if its really close to the sugar

If the dog is not pushing object, it slowly comes to a stop starting from a speed of Dog_Last_Push_Speed, which was updated to the dog's speed last time it was pushing the sugar. (Checks that its not being pushed & that the angle of  object movement is to the right)

If the dog is not pushing object & its angle of movement is going left (ie it has come to a stop and the forces applied to it are pushing it to the left) set the last push speed to 0 & remove all forces, as well as resets the Dog_Last_Push_Speed variable

If the dog is not pushing object, it slowly comes to a stop starting from a speed of Dog_Last_Push_Speed, which was updated to the dog's speed last time it was pushing the sugar. (Checks that its not being pushed & that the angle of  object movement is to the right)

If the dog is not pushing object & its angle of movement is going left (ie it has come to a stop and the forces applied to it are pushing it to the left) set the last push speed to 0 & remove all forces, as well as resets the Dog_Last_Push_Speed variable
If the sugar is touching the wall, stop
